text: Hi, I am new to HubSpot custom development. I want to create a custom app for the marketplace - I have looked at the docs but they seem overwhelming. Can someone show me a sample app on github maybe and steps to upload the app on HubSpot. I am seeing HubSpot modules, templates but dont see how they are connecting to marketplace app development anywhere.

trying to build something similar to this - <https://app.HubSpot.com/ecosystem/19938962/marketplace/apps/finance/accounting/quickbooks-online>
with lesser functionality
We have created one HubSpot theme already, now working on 2nd. May I know how can I create multiple blog and blog details from and within same developer account?

We have a tutorial where you create a sample app. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/en/docs-beta/idea-tracker-tutorial-part-1|https://developers.HubSpot.com/en/docs-beta/idea-tracker-tutorial-part-1>

Here are the marketplace listing instructions as well: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/listing-your-app|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/listing-your-app>
What template type do you use when setting up an email subscription page template?
Under site settings you can create a new blog. Make a new blog then you can choose different blog templates for that new blog
scroll the dropdown
email subscription preferences page

Also btw if you use the boilerplate this file is included automatically and set up to use the same header and footer as your other pages
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/tree/main/src/templates/system>
Anybody else struggling with preview links intermittently having redirect loop issues?
I’m having problems with pushing data layers to google - I need a trigger when email is submitted on the chat bot. Could someone advise?

LOL I posted this yesterday :slightly_smiling_face:

Yes, yes I am
Ha hi Jordan

Anyone seeing this warning/error:
```DevTools failed to load SourceMap: Could not parse content for <https://app.HubSpot.com/content/editor/prefetcher.js.map>: Unexpected token ! in JSON at position 0```
I think it's somehow breaking a part of my page
Ahhhh I will give it a try. It is connected to a hubDB dynamic page and is live. Will doing this break the live site  or should i clone it to the test to play around

<@U0233UGSH9U> Well you dont want to mess with the live table. So dont go into the table and make any edits. But if you jsut make a new page all together and connect that page to hubDB the way that I mentioned above you will then see the module displaying data from the table.

If you need to edit the module because it’s currently live and needs updates I would recommend cloning the module and using that clone to make youre edits on the test page. This way you can isolate your edits and it wont effect the live site or the live module. Then when you are finished with your edits you can copy them over to the live module and delete the test one
Does that make sense? You can DM if you need some help
Yea, it definitely is. Does anybody know what that is usually related to?
it's connected to a single module
I "fixed" it. It looks like a file somewhere was cached and breaking the HubSpot concatenation step. Still have to do some more research.
thanks <@U7SL518D6>

." please let me know how to fix that. Thanks in advance
